intro: Baccharoides ringoetii, commonly known as the ringoet's baccharoides, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
